description: Cognitive3D is the leading analytics solution designed specifically for getting insights from VR/AR apps.
capabilities: : Get a 1-to-1 replay of exactly what people did within your VR/AR app by tracking their eyes, hands, and head.
: Track your app performance across different devices. Identify where frames are dropping off or when the device battery was over-taxed.
: Track immersive insights such as comfort and presence based on people’s use of space in VR/AR.
: Tag objects of interest and discover how people interact with them in the 3D environment.

description: Calculate real-world aircraft weight and balance data for your flight simulation project.
capabilities: Data table workflow which allows the development through the settings of the principle data tables with multiple aircraft selection and profiling of weight and balance data.

Center Of Gravity Calculations (Displayed and Back-end Data): Total Weight, Total Moments, Longitudinal CG Arm, Percent MAC, Forward CG Arm Limitation, Aft CG Arm Limitation, Over Max Weight State, Outside CG Limits State, Category Number, Category, Payload Weight Data, Fuel Weight Data, and Oil Weight Data.
Automatic transfer of CG data to the player pawn.

Center Of Gravity Visualization: visualization of the center of gravity location, forward limitation, and aft limitation in relation to the Mean Aerodynamic Chord (0% MAC to 100% MAC). Forward and aft limit bars provide color indications of the CG state.
Demonstrates the implementation of the transferred CG calculations and simulates the principle effects of weight distribution on the longitudinal (pitch) stability of the aircraft.
Demo fixed wing aircraft data: Trainer, Acrobatic, and Commuter.
Control Panel: Pitch Trim, Airspeed, Center Of Lift, and Center Of Gravity Scale.

description: The Procedural City Generator (PCG) is a set of editor tools that helps you quickly generate true-to-scale cities in your scene. PCG is designed to be flexible and extensible to allow you to customize each city to your needs.
capabilities: Create one or multiple connected cities in your scene
Easily adjust the shape and size of the City Limits
- allow you to design your city according to specific zone parameters. Each zone allows you to specify a variety of options, including the buildings, props, and foliage that can spawn within it.
- Procedural Road Generation creates a realistic road network for your city. The generator creates Highways, Main Roads, Minor Roads, and Side Roads
- Spawn building meshes according to the City Zone to give each area of your city a specific style
- Spawn Fixed and Random Props according to your City Zone
- Spawn City Foliage along the roads. In addition, you can spawn Area and Spline-based foliage for more customization
- Use your own building, props, and foliage meshes to change the look of your city!
Bonus Drivable vehicles - cars, planes, and boats

description: A modular set to build your own Convenience Store environment. Suitable for both First Person and Third Person Games.
Scope Materials and Scope Mechanic

The World Director NPC plugin is ideal for creating games where there are many pawns in the world at the same time. You can simulate a whole world of thousands of pawns. You can create an entire populated city. The plugin is easy to use.
capabilities: The system is divided into 4 optimization levels that work simultaneously for the best FPS performance.

At level 1 if the pawn is out of the camera's view, all its components and skeletal meshes are disabled from the render, and a set of optimization measures is applied, such as animation playback and tick rate. While at level 2.3.4, pawns can't act according to the Behavior Tree, but they can still walk.
On my system with an AMD 2700X processor, I achieved
All calculations for hidden pawns at level 2.3.4 occur using multithreading for better FPS.
If the pawn is out of the camera's view, all its components and skeletal meshes are disabled from the render.
The plugin is easy to use.

description: Spline based Orbital System for Actors, incl. Mass based Speed
capabilities: 1.0.1 - Fixed a small Bug with Orbit Names - March 15 2021
1.0.2 - Fixed a Problem with scaling the Speed of Sub-Orbits - January 08 2022

1.0.3 - Fixed a Problem with the Orbit Plane, after upgrading to UE5 - If you want to fix it yourself on an existing Project: Go to the "OrbitBuilder" Blueprint: “Construct Orbit Plane and Material” Function → "Make Vector" needs Z=1 instead of Z=0
1.1.0 - Added dynamic Orbit Material (Planets can now have trails):

1.3.0 - Added Orbits Trails, that can be viewed from the Side too (Tessellation only works in UE 4 atm) - Optimized the construction of Splines. Even using only 2 Spline Points will work now. For good results use 4 or more. - Added Scaling for every Orbit individually. - Added easy method to change Orbit Speed during Gameplay.

1.4.0 - Added new Plane Orbit Mesh and Material - Added High Quality Orbit Mesh for UE5 - Added another Orbit, that can be viewed from the side, that is cheaper in Performance - Some Optimizations - Fixed a Bug with using different Ticks (Using fixed Ticks like 0.1 should now give a similar result as real time).
1.5.0 - Added the ability to jump to a time in the Future (in Seconds, during construction). - Fixed some minor Bugs.
1.5.3- June 21 2023 - Fixed a problem that affected dynamic Orbit Materials on huge elliptical Orbits. Existing Materials should still work
1.6.0 - December 2023 - Added several Scaling Options. Actors, Orbit Materials and Orbit Speed can now be all scaled along with the Orbit. - Fixed some Problems with dynamic Materials.
